SAYS: I heard about Santa Barbara newcomers through one of the board members who helped bring me here to Santa Barbara.
I think selecting which ones you're going to participate in is a little daunting.
I think you could be using much newer or more innovative ways to get people's attention.
I never once used the website. I used the app.
I was looking for some committees that I had an interest in or that I had a shared interest in.
The homepage looks like you're starting either a surfing club or a lifeguarding club.
Too many words. It's way too much detail.
THINKS: Joining a community is important for settling into a new area.
There are too many choices available, leading to confusion about where to engage.
The website does not reflect the vibrancy of the organization.
The app is more user-friendly than the website, indicating that the website may not be a priority.
There is a need for clearer navigation and organization on the website.
The information overload might deter potential new members.
The organization could benefit from a more modern and engaging digital presence.
DOES: Discussed joining the newcomers group with his wife.
Used the app exclusively for event registration and information.
Attended events and engaged with the community through the app.
Skipped using the website after initial registration.
Provided detailed feedback on the website and its usability.
Expressed interest in specific committees that matched personal interests.
FEELS: Excited about the opportunity to connect with new people.
Overwhelmed by the number of clubs and groups available.
Frustrated by the dated appearance and usability of the website.
Concerned that the website might deter new members from joining.
Desires a more engaging and visually appealing online experience.
Wants to feel welcomed and informed as a newcomer, which is not reflected in the current website.
